clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Prevalence and Risk Factors for Patients With Peri-implant Disease
clinical_study.official_title: The Prevalence and Risk Factors for Patients With Peri-implant Diseaseï¼š A Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the prevalence and risk factors for peri-implant disease in partially edentulous patients rehabilitated with implants supported crown or bridge so as to provide evidence for clinical prevention and control.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of the present study is to identify the prevalence of peri-implant disease in partially edentulous subjects treated with osseointegrated implants, using clinical parameters, as well as to analyse the possible disease association with demographic, behavioural, and biological risk variables.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the 5 years after prosthetic loading.
primary_outcome.description: Peri-implant disease includes Peri-implant mucositis and Peri-implantitis.Peri-implant mucositis: BoP/suppuration but no detectable bone loss. Peri-implantitis: BoP/suppuration and bone loss >2 mm.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the first day,6 months 1,3 and 5 years after prosthetic loading.
secondary_outcome.description: Gingival bleeding on probing (BOP) using the modified sulcus bleeding index for implants. Scale equals 0 = No bleeding when periodontal probe is passed along the gingival margin;1 = Isolated bleeding spots visible;2 = Blood forms a confluent red line on the gingival margin;3 = Heavy or profuse bleeding.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the first day,6 months 1,3 and 5 years after prosthetic loading.
secondary_outcome.description: PD will be measured from the free gingival margin to the base of the pocket and will be recorded in whole millimeters (mm).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the first day,6 months 1,3 and 5 years after prosthetic loading.
secondary_outcome.description: Marginal bone loss will be assessed by periapical radiographs taken with the paralleling technique.

arm_group.description: The subjects who did not suffer from peri-implant disease.
The subjects who suffered from peri-implant disease.

study_pop.textblock: Partially edentulous patients implant dental implants and will be restored with implant-supported fixed partial dentures and single crowns at the Department of Prosthodontics, School of Stomatology of the Fourth Military Medical University

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Partially edentulous patients will implant at least one implant and will be restored with implant-supported fixed partial dentures and single crowns.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Jaw radiotherapy treatment before and after implanting. Patients who have bruxism,xerostomia or the adjacent teeth periapical periodontitis.
- Patients who suffered with oral mucosa disease,or aggressive periodontitis or jaw defect.
- Patients who suffered with mental and psychological disease will influence their oral health normal maintenance.
